reviewText:
For David Janssen fans, this is a fun DVD to see. He is very young and only really starting out on his career. He is quite good in the role and
the story keeps it interesting. I enjoyed seeing Dina Merrill looking so great and acting very well, as always. This would not be on my "must see" list of movies, but worth viewing if you are fans of the headliners.

I read the book, "Twenty Plus Two" in the 1960's and loved the story.  I saw in the 1990's that there had been a film made.  I looked high and low for a copy and was thrilled when I found it on Amazon.  I watch it over and over and it is still one of my favorite films.
David Janssen is always easy on the eyes and it is fun caper
Good movie. Love Jeanne Crain. She adds so much to a movie because of her style. David janissen too.
I really enjoyed this movie.  I like David Janssen.

David Janssen was always great as a PI, cop, and fugitive. Twenty Plus Two has him playing a finder of missing people. Like Warning Shot, the film has great character actors moving the plot along. The plot is simple. Janssen believes a cold case isn't so cold and despite everyone telling him he's wrong, he proves he is right. Even if you guess the truth before the story has not progressed too far, it is a good B movie.
It was a great dvd, with a fine, entertaining story in the movie. I would recommend this to all David Janssen fans.

I have always been a fan of David Janssen and this movie is as good as always. I think anyone would enjoy this older movie if they are into that. I certainly did enjoy seeing it again after all these years.
It wasn't his best movie but I liked it.  You can't beat the Fugitive or Harry O in his acting career.
